### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ # using environment with paraview@master and trying to set versions for llvm and llvmlib
$ cat spack.yaml
# This is a Spack Environment file.
#
# It describes a set of packages to be installed, along with
# configuration settings.
spack:
  # add package specs to the `specs` list
  specs: [mesa]
  view: true
  packages:
    llvm:
      version: [7]
    libllvm:
      version: [7]
    llvm-amdgpu:
      version: [7]
$ spack concretize -f
...
 -   lqsnhre          ^llvm@12.0.1%gcc@7.5.0+clang~code_signing
```


### Error message

N/A


### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.17.1-1378-8cefe38b0e
* **Python:** 3.6.9
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu18.04-zen2
* **Concretizer:** clingo


### Additional information

@haampie @trws

[spack.yaml.txt](https://github.com/spack/spack/files/8164260/spack.yaml.txt)


### General information

- [X] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [X] I have run `spack maintainers <name-of-the-package>` and **@mentioned** any maintainers
- [X] I have uploaded the build log and environment files
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Installation issue: Can't change LLVM version as dependency in Spack environment
